thread.title: Medomak surges to gridiron win over Five Town
thread.title_full: Medomak surges to gridiron win over Five Town

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Medomak surges to gridiron win over Five Town
text:
Medomak surges to gridiron win over Five Town By Staff | Oct 07, 2015 Photo by: Mark Haskell Medomak's Darius Pierpont, left, runs around the end against Five Town in a middle school football game Oct. 6 in Union. The Panthers won 52-8. 
Union â€” Two Midcoast Eastern Maine Middle School Football League squads converged on the gridiron Tuesday, Oct. 6 as Five Town Football traveled to face Medomak at the Union Elementary School field. 
Medomak, unbeaten thus far on the season, remained so as it rumbled to a 52-8 win over FTF. 
Click for photos from this game. 
Medomak is 4-0-1 through five games, including a 20-6 win over Pittsfield Sept. 8, a 26-6 win over Bucksport Sept. 22 and a 36-6 win over Mount Desert Island Sept. 29. The team also battled Hampden to a 14-14 tie Sept. 16. 
In Tuesday's win over FTF, Medomak quarterback Darius Pierpont scored multiple touchdowns on the ground and though the air, including connecting with Lance Bennett on a pair of scores. Dylan O'Reilly also scored multiple TDs for Medomak on the day. 
Jacob Knowlton scored the lone touchdown and two-point conversion for Five Town. 
FTF is 1-4 through five games, including a 28-12 win over Oceanside, a 20-7 loss to Brewer, a 28-6 loss to Bangor and a 6-0 loss to MDI, coupled with Tuesday's loss to Medomak. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401. Five Town and Medomak players battle on the field, including Medomak's Dylan O'Reilly, with ball, and Gabe Shelman, as well as Five Town's Jacob Knowlton, left, and Braden Moulton.
